<summary>What's your diagnosis</summary>
<br>
Pulmonary Echinococcosis

</details>

<details close>

<summary>Notes</summary>
<br>
**Agent:** <br>Most commonly due to infetation by larvae of *Echinococcus granulosus* (dog tapeworm); Definitive host: dog, Intermediate host: sheep
<br><br>
**Epidemiology:** More common in females; occurs often in liver and lung
<br><br>
**Treatment:** <br>Resection is curative but recurrence in about 10%.
<br><br>
**Microscopy:** <br>Typically three layers. Middle laminated ectocyst layer is well appreciated in the image. <br> Can be highlighted by PAS-stain.
<br><br>
**Differential diagnosis:** <br> E.multilocularis has thin laminated layer, usually with minimal or no germinal layer.
<br>
<br>
**Reference:** <br>https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/parasitologyechinococcus.html

</details>
